panama.log
Class SimpleLog

java.lang.Object
  panama.log.SimpleLog

public final class SimpleLog
extends java.lang.Object

Controls the configuration and formatting of a group of SimpleLoggers.

SimpleLog has a default instance, which is probably the only one that anyone will ever use. If you use the default instance, you don't even really need to know anything about SimpleLog - just use the basic SimpleLogger constructor and you'll never even know nor care.

Version:
$Revision: 1.24 $
Author:
$Author: grlea $

Constructor Detail

SimpleLog

public SimpleLog(java.util.Properties properties)
Creates a new SimpleLog configured by the given properties object.
All SimpleLogs log to System.err by default.

Parameters:
properties - a properties object containing properties that will be used to configure the SimpleLog.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if properties is null.

          throws java.io.IOException
Creates a new SimpleLog configured by a properties file read from the given URL.

Parameters:
configurationSource - the properties file to use to configure the SimpleLog instance.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if the properties file cannot be read from the given URL.

SimpleLog

public SimpleLog(java.io.File configurationSource)
          throws java.io.IOException

Creates a new SimpleLog configured by a specified properties file.

Note that this is merely a convenience method equivalent to: new SimpleLog(configurationSource.toURL())

Parameters:
configurationSource - the properties file to use to configure the SimpleLog instance.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if an error occurs interpreting the file name as a URL or if the properties file cannot be read.
Method Detail

reloadProperties

public void reloadProperties()
Reloads this SimpleLog's configuration.

setDefaultInstance

public static void setDefaultInstance(SimpleLog log)

Sets the default instance of SimpleLog.

If the default instance has already been initialised and has been used to create one or more SimpleLoggers, this method will print a warning on System.err but the operation will still be completed.

Parameters:
log - the SimpleLog instance to be used as the default instance

defaultInstance

public static SimpleLog defaultInstance()

Returns the default instance of SimpleLog. If one has not been set manually, a default instance is created and initialised automatically.

The automatically-initialised default instance is configured:

  • from a properties file specified in the value of the system property simplelog.configuration via the classpath or file system, depending on whether the property value begins with classpath: or file:
  • or, if the system property is not specified, from a properties file found on the classpath with the name 'simplelog.properties' (this is the most usual method of configuration)
  • or, if that file is not found in the classpath, not configured at all, in which case Simple Log will produce no output whatsoever unless a writer is programmatically assigned (see setWriter(java.io.PrintWriter)).

If your chosen method of configuration does not appear to be working, you can set the value of the simplelog.dev.debug system property to true to see where Simple Log is looking for its configuration.

Returns:
the default instance of SimpleLog.

println

Prints the given string to this SimpleLog's output destination, followed by a newline sequence.

Parameters:
s - the string to print

Registers the give logger with this SimpleLog, so that the logger can be updaed if the properties change.

Parameters:
logger - the logger to register

isPipingOutputToConsole

public boolean isPipingOutputToConsole()
Returns whether this SimpleLog, when printing output to a file, will also print the output to the console. This attribute has no effect when output is not going to a file.

Returns:
true if output will be piped to the console, false if it won't.

setPipingOutputToConsole

public void setPipingOutputToConsole(boolean pipeOutputToConsole)
Sets whether this SimpleLog, when printing output to a file, should also print the output to the console. This attribute has no effect when output is not going to a file.

Parameters:
pipeOutputToConsole - true if output should be piped to the console as well as the output file, false if it should not.
